arts.ttl: Supercopa is just the start for Flick’s Barca
arts.sum: This is a Real Madrid team that picked up Kylian Mbappe, and was supposed to storm through Spain and Europe. The Spanish Supercopa is what should be the first of many trophies for Hansi Flick as the manager of Barcelona.

arts.ttl: Managing Madrid Podcast: Real Madrid 2 - 5 Barcelona, Post-game, Spanish Super Cup, 2025
arts.sum: On this Members-only episode of the Managing Madrid Podacst, Kiyan Sobhani, Matt Wiltse, and Siddharth Ramsundar discuss: It also serves as a means for Real Madrid fans to connect and discuss the team.

arts.ttl: Chelsea 'leading race' for £40m Ben Chilwell replacement as Arsenal, Real Madrid suffer setback
arts.sum: Chelsea reportedly steal a march on Real Madrid and Arsenal in the race to sign 18-year-old Ajax defender Jorrel Hato, who is valued at £40m.

arts.ttl: Player Ratings: Real Madrid 2 - 5 Barcelona; 2025 Spanish Super Cup
arts.sum: Ferland Mendy — 5.5: Had moments of solid defending against Lamine Yamal but struggled at times when the teenager cut inside too easily. Substituted early in the second half.

arts.ttl: Carlo Ancelotti names one Real Madrid star as ‘the only good thing’ in Barcelona defeat
arts.sum: Real Madrid head coach Carlo Ancelotti has moved to single one member of his squad out for special praise, on the back of their defeat at the hands of Barcelona.…

arts.ttl: Barcelona thrash Real Madrid in chaotic clásico Spanish Super cup final
arts.sum: Spanish Super Cup final: Barcelona 5-2 Real Madrid Barça shrug off Szczesny red card after first-half blitz “I don’t know what’s going on with the clásicos but they have been a bit mad recently,” Carlo Ancelotti had said and here was another one. There had been 35 goals in the last 10 meetings between these two great rivals and there were seven more in the final of the Spanish Super Cup. The only pity was that it happened in the wrong place. FC Barcelona had put four past Real Madrid at the Santiago Bernabéu in October; now they went one better on their way to an extraordinary 5-2 victory, 5,000km away in Jeddah, a night when they played with two goalkeepers ending with a third, the injured captain Marc Andre ter Stegen, lifting the trophy. Barcelona had finished a man down and started a goal down, Wojciech Szczęsny beaten early and sent off later, but ultimately it didn’t matter. Hansi Flick’s side were just too good. Exceptional in fact, Raphinha tireless until he was withdrawn, cramp clawing at his calf, Lamine Yamal for ever sending opponents the wrong way and Pedri gliding across another stage. For an hour they dominated and then, for half an hour, once Szczęsny had been shown a red card, they controlled with a coolness that made light of how long was left and the history and talent of the team before them. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Ancelotti: “Mbappe played well, we have to forget about the rest”
arts.sum: Ancelotti was asked about the performances from the players and whether there was any positive he takes from the game, and he said: “I have nothing to hold back. “The game was about defending well.

arts.ttl: Ruthless Barcelona thrash Real Madrid to win Spanish Super Cup
arts.sum: Real Madrid 2-5 Barcelona: A captivating Clasico saw Hansi Flick’s side get their hands on silverware in Jeddah

arts.ttl: Real Madrid 2-5 Barcelona: Player ratings as Raphinha stars in Clasico thumping
arts.sum: Player ratings from Real Madrid 2-5 Barcelona.

arts.ttl: Real Madrid fans call for Carlo Ancelotti’s head after Barcelona defeat
arts.sum: Supporters of Real Madrid have on Sunday night come together, to call for the immediate dismissal of head coach Carlo Ancelotti. This comes amid what has proven an alarming evening’s…
